alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:55PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama, Jackson, northeastern Bay, northern Calhoun, east central Walton, Holmes and Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, western Decatur and Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia through 745 PM EDT/645 PM CDT/... At 653 PM EDT/553 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Geneva to 9 miles north of Chattahoochee. Movement was south at 35 mph. At 535PM EDT the Donalsonville A/P reported a wind gust of 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Bonifay, Blountstown, Marianna, Chipley, Graceville, Chattahoochee, Bradford, Live Oak, Malone, Sneads, Cottondale, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Ponce De Leon, Altha, Alford, Caryville, Wausau and Esto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama.
